dialogue.String: 1�Give one #���� to Chacharoon and holler that you need help harvesting such a hearty haul, kupo.
1�Additionally, I'll let you know that Chacharoon favors friends that are awe-inspiring adventurers at the apex of their accomplishments.
1�Before consoling Chacharoon, I insist you set sail for your home nation.
1�Once there, tap into the tenets of Trust. Only then will you be able to truly tackle the trepidations that terrorize Susuroon.
1�Head for the hills and console Chacharoon!
1�Bring your butt to the boat and take the tiny trail to the top. Stare in stupefied silence at the ravishing refurbishment of the range!
1�I will prepare an appropriate moogle soup to aid this afflicted adamantoise, kupo.
1�Bring me twelve %���� so that I can brew the best bisque to tend to our tepid tortoise.
1�Getting a fourth creature into our rearing grounds is bound to be a fearsome feat.
1�Could you please help poor Chacharoon keep up with inventory before he gets buried under a mound of monster manure?
1�Head to the Goblins' shop in Lower Jeuno for supplies. We're counting on you, kupo!
1�Superb! You've returned with the supplies! Just drop them off in the rearing grounds out back, kupo.
1�Back in your Mog House, I bet gardening was a chore. Here, however, it's a delightful diversion from the wild and woolly world outside.
1�Simply stick your snout in that basket over there, and declare your discoveries to me.
1�Examine the earth-rupturing roots to reveal riveting rewards!
1�Well, maybe not ��riveting,�� but rewards nonetheless, kupo.Either way, take some time to talk to me when you're done.
1�A rotten reprobate's been running around like a rogue in the Mog Garden, kupo.
1�To stop this sorry sod, we'll need  $���� from that bulky boulder beyond. Once you get it, make me aware and we'll go from there.
1�Nurse the netting out of the swelling spring to see if that evil entity got entangled in it.
1�Should you find fishy fragments--or anything at all--apprise me as soon as you're able, kupo.
1�It's detestable, deplorable, despicable even!No one pillages this paradise from perimeter to pole and gets away with it, kupo!
1�What was that? Poles and perimeters aren't perfectly paired, and this profligate isn't pillaging per se, kupo?

1�Dear Chacharoon,I may have taught you all the basics of caring for feral monsters, but you are still a child. I do not expect you to remember everything, so I have jotted down the things I deem most important.
1�Please do not take this the wrong way, but I do not yet think you are capable of raising multiple beasts at the same time. One should be plenty for now.
1�If you decide to take care of another creature, you will have to part ways with the one for which you are currently caring.
1�If you are to develop a bond with your animal, then it is best that you give it a name. Do not worry about thinking of the perfect name, because you can always change it later.
1�Rearing beasts with an emphasis on ��personal growth�� will cause them to grow up little by little. When they finally do get big, they might just reward you with something for your efforts.
1�Emphasizing ��enjoying the moment�� lets your creature live at its own pace and does wonders for its spirit. However, it will not get any bigger than it already is.
1�Do not forget to bond physically with your creature. Each species has its own likes and dislikes, though, so try interacting with them in many different ways.
1�I warn you against being too strict with them, however. If you do too many terrible things to them, they will succumb to darkness and turn on you.
